title: Microsoft backs new duty of care laws to protect children from online harms
text:
Microsoft, the world’s biggest tech company, has backed the Government’s plans for a statutory duty of care as it says regulation is essential to protect children from online harms.

Hugh Milward, the software giant’s head of corporate, external and legal affairs, said “proper regulation” overseen by a new regulator was needed to help restore the public’s trust in tech firms which had been “broken.”

He suggested the planned “duty of care” for which The Telegraph has campaigned could provide a model to be adopted worldwide.

His comments come amid pressure on the Government to push through its plans with detailed legislation in the Queen’s Speech, due on Monday.
